messages.message: If someone has a code snippet that answers this question, it would be great to turn that snippet into a snippet for the new Text Editor!~!
@Jonathan Shih another use case for resource folder? :stuck_out_tongue:

@Aaron Vontell @Justin hahaha yes and no. I was able to load a pickle folder. I’ll answer the stackoverflow question, but here is an example: https://instabase.com/jmshih/tests/fs/Instabase%20Drive/files/text_classification/Samples/10-Q/scripts/text_classification_standalone.py. Short story is that pickle also has a “loads” method that can be used to load from a bytestring.
jaykay chetan beat me to answering the stackoverflow :slightly_smiling_face:
to @Justin’s point, though, for a binary, this only works if you can get the full path to the resource folder.
@Jonathan Shih @Chetan what happens in the case where this is in a binary? It seems like I need to give a repo name and owner for it to be a full path, but I don’t have that info

yeah… gg :smile: haha jk. you can place the pickle file in the .flow/ib/custom folder, and it should get picked up as well (i was having some trouble, but it should be possible to get it working at some point). then you can read it in with the ib.custom library. We’re currently working on creating a resources folder that will hopefully solve this, and targeting the apr release, though.
yea for a binary we would need that resources folder.
or to have binary execution-time arguments specify an output directory (which is do-able from what I’ve heard but I’ve never attempted it myself)
@Jonathan Shih you know anything about that? ^
I guess more specifically what I am trying to do is actually load a resource file within a marketplace solution
Resource file in Marketplace solution is something we should do @Jonathan Shih. It was a TODO we didn’t get to, but should be able to complete

Right, we discussed and will be packaging it up in a ibsolution as well. For now, you can pass in a path in the runtime configs. In the future, in addition to packaging it in an ibsolution, in order to get it working with just an ibflowbin as well, we will also pass in the full path to the ibflowbin, so that the resource folders can be placed relative to the ibflowbin. Here’s the design doc (WIP) for this feature: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1jURx0jRhvcixcsZvpyiZmssIIS2NZE07A2fYqvfQRvg/edit?ts=5e83d66d
I see, regarding runtime config, the issue is that the user will not have access to this UDF/ibflowbin, this is a custom UDF from a marketplace pypkg
*wont have access to the UDF or resource file

I see. yeah, I’m not sure on what the current situation is regarding how pypkg are created and whether we can currently access other files from within the pypkg that is not included in a binary. @Kerry do you know any more about this?
